explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 358degC (ICSC, 1999)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: No data available. Corrosivity to metals remains uncertain, though classified as "corrosive substances" (as the classification based on UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods includes "skin corrosivity") (UN#2079).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 1,315mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 1,080mg/kg (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), 1,140mg/kg, 1,539mg/kg, 1,800mg/kg, 1,950mg/kg (SIDS (1996)), and 2,330mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 718mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 672mg/kg, 1,040mg/kg (SIDS (1996)), 1,090mg/kg (ACGIH (7th 2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the LC50 value (4 hours) of 170ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (4 hour inhalation of vapor) of 70mg/L (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapor concentration (370ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 37Pa (20degC) (ICSC (1999)), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on data on human health effects (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.50 (2004)) and the testing data of rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.50 (2004), SIDS (1996)) (administration of the undiluted solution shows "corrosiveness"), although the substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on data on human health effects (MOE Risk Assessment Vol. 2 (2003), ACGIH (7th, 2001)) and the testing data of rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.50 (2004), SIDS (1996)) ("corrosive," "highly corrosive," and "loss of vision").

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause allergy or asthma symptoms or breathing difficulties if inhaled
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on data on human health effects (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.50 (2004), SIDS (1996), ACGIH (7th, 2001))

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the testing data of guinea pig skin sensitization tests (based on the Maximization method) (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.50 (2004), SIDS (1996)) and data on human health effects (MOE Risk Assessment Vol. 2 (2003), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.50 (2004), SIDS (1996), ACGIH 7th (2001)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleous tests), described in NITE Initial Risk Assessment No. 50 (2005), ATSDR (1996).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on expert judgment, given the absence of existing classification and the results of several carcinogenicity tests.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the description in NITE Initial Risk Assessment No.50 (2005): The results of rat developmental toxicity studies (OECD TG 421) suggest adverse effects on reproductive/developmental functions at dose levels not toxic to parent animals.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 48 hours EC50=16mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (SIDS, 1996).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although the acute toxicity was Category 3, judging from the NOEC=5.6mg/L during 21 days of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (SIDS, 1996), it was classified into Not classified.
